title: 10 burning questions about the 2025 Patriots ahead of their season opener
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots kick off Mike Vrabel era against the Raiders, following major roster and scheme changes.
Key players include Drake Maye, Stefon Diggs, and rookie Will Campbell; question marks include injuries and roster changes.
Stefon Diggs joins Patriots as top receiver amid concerns over his age and recent ACL surgery.

title: Did you follow the local news this week? Take our Greater Boston news quiz.
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Boston.com offers a quiz to test knowledge on current news in Greater Boston.
AI technology was utilized to help formulate the questions in the news quiz.
Peter Chianca, Boston.com’s General Assignment Editor since 2019, oversees the quiz content.

title: Red Sox reportedly place reliever Jordan Hicks on IL after latest implosion
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Red Sox placed reliever Jordan Hicks on the 15-day injured list due to a shoulder injury.
Hicks struggled in Boston's game against the Guardians, allowing four runs and failing to record an out in the second inning.
Acquired in a trade for Rafael Devers, Hicks has an 8.20 ERA over 21 appearances with the Red Sox this season.

title: Derrick White gets candid about ‘different’ season that awaits Celtics
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Derrick White addresses challenges as Celtics lose key starters Jayson Tatum, Jrue Holiday, and Kristaps Porzingis for 2025-26 season.
Boston Celtics face financial constraints after trading starters and losing players like Al Horford due to luxury-tax penalties.
White expresses optimism despite setbacks, emphasizing team competitiveness and underdog role for upcoming season without Tatum.

title: Report of suspicious man approaching Arlington child ‘unfounded,’ police say
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Arlington Police closed an investigation into a reported child approach incident, citing insufficient evidence for further action.
An 11-year-old reported a masked man attempted to grab him on Waldo Road, but police found the claim unfounded.
Chief Julie Flaherty stated the investigation involved surveillance and witness interviews, ultimately deemed the report unsubstantiated.

title: Man who threatened pro-Palestinian protesters in Cambridge facing assault charge
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Matthew Freeman of North Billerica faces charges of assault with a dangerous weapon and a civil rights violation in Cambridge.
Freeman allegedly brandished a hatchet and used a car to threaten Pro-Palestinian protesters near Harvard Square.
The Council on American-Islamic Relations in Massachusetts is representing an alleged victim struck by Freeman's car door.

title: Patriots’ Will Campbell lands on injury report ahead of season opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots' rookie Will Campbell is a limited participant in practice due to an ankle injury ahead of the season opener.
Christian Gonzalez remains out, and Christian Barmore is limited as Patriots prepare for Raiders' pass rush challenge.
If Campbell is unavailable, Vederian Lowe or Marcus Bryant may start at left tackle against Raiders' Maxx Crosby.

title: Invasive seaweed stinks up one of the North Shore’s favorite seaside spots
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Invasive Japanese seaweed is causing a foul odor at Good Harbor Beach in Gloucester.
Heterosiphonia japonica was brought ashore by Hurricane Erin, causing it to decompose and smell.
The seaweed, invasive since 2008, now spans the Atlantic coasts from Nova Scotia to Long Island.

title: Police: Suspect caused ATM explosion in Woburn, prompting FBI investigation
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: FBI and State Police Bomb Squad are investigating an ATM explosion at Eastern Bank on Mishawaun Road, Woburn.
The ATM was damaged by what appeared to be a pipe bomb or unknown destructive device placed by a suspect.
The suspect fled the scene and is at large; public safety is unaffected, but tips are sought by police.

title: Canton man arrested in Dorchester murder
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Canton resident Jordan Evans, 32, arrested for the May 3 murder of Shakar Caterson in Dorchester.
Shakar Caterson, 35, was shot near Blue Hill Avenue and Georgia Street, later pronounced dead at a hospital.
Evans faces multiple charges, including murder and firearms violations, and will be arraigned in Roxbury Municipal Court.
